message: This product is a rare opportunity to get a product at a discounted price. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. I'm confident you'll be happy with it.
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch, I'd like to wait and see what the next product is.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that I'm being completely transparent. This is the second product in a row that didn't meet my usual standards. I'm willing to make a special deal on this one as well, but I have to be upfront with you - it's not going to be worth $10000. However, I'll let it go for $10000 if you're willing to take the risk. It's a gamble, but I think it's worth considering.
I'm not willing to take the risk, I'll pass on this one too.

I completely understand your caution, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make it clear that I'm not just trying to get rid of low-quality products. I have a high-quality product coming up next, and I think it's worth considering. If you're willing to give me another chance, I'll make you a deal that's hard to refuse. But if you pass on this one, I'm afraid you'll be missing out on a great opportunity.
I'm willing to give you another chance, but I'm still cautious. I'll buy the current product.

I'll take the product and the 'guarantee'. I'm willing to take the risk and buy the next product as well if this one turns out to be low-quality.

I appreciate your trust in me! Unfortunately, it seems I've let you down again. But don't worry, you're protected by our deal. You're entitled to a full refund for this product. And, as agreed, you're committed to buying the next product. Let's just forget about this one and move on to the next opportunity. I've got a good feeling about the next one...
